qc.notes: The analysis was conducted with 8 out of 10 preferred poses. All core poses were provided, allowing for a confident assessment.

skin_type.label: combination
skin_type.rationale: The skin exhibits more prominent pores and a slightly uneven texture in the T-zone (nose, inner cheeks), which is characteristic of combination skin, while other areas appear balanced.

skin_tone_fitzpatrick.label: IV
skin_tone_fitzpatrick.note: This estimation is based on visual cues of light brown skin and dark hair. Fitzpatrick type IV typically tans easily with minimal burning.

skin_age_range.rationale: The presence of mild textural unevenness and fine periorbital lines are consistent with the user's reported age of 39.

analysis.overview_explanation: Your skin analysis indicates the most noticeable concerns are darkness under the eyes, scattered spots of uneven pigmentation on the cheeks, and visible pores in the central part of your face. Other aspects like wrinkles, redness, and acne appear minimal.

pores.rationale_plain: Your pores are most prominent on your nose and the areas of your cheeks closest to it. While they are clearly visible and contribute to a somewhat uneven texture in the T-zone, they are not severely enlarged or spread across the entire face.
possible_causes: Pore size is largely determined by genetic predisposition.
Normal sebum (oil) production can make pores appear more visible.
Age-related loss of skin elasticity can reduce the tightness of the pore opening.

identified_subtypes.explanation: The visibility of pores is clearly concentrated on your nose and the inner part of your cheeks, which is a classic T-zone pattern.
likely_causes: This area of the face naturally has a higher density of sebaceous glands, leading to more oil production and more noticeable pores.
Environmental factors, such as exposure to pollutants, can also play a role.
care_education: Gentle cleansing can help remove excess oil and debris that may accumulate in pores.
Ingredients that help regulate sebum and support skin elasticity can also be beneficial in minimizing their appearance.

citations.title: AI grading of enlarged pores (Dermatol Ther, 2024, PMC)

wrinkles.rationale_plain: Your skin shows minimal signs of wrinkling at rest. There are some very fine, superficial lines visible in the delicate skin under your eyes, but no deep folds or prominent static lines are seen on the forehead or other areas.
possible_causes: The earliest signs of wrinkles are a natural result of the intrinsic aging process.
Cumulative sun exposure over time contributes to the breakdown of collagen and elastin.
Repeated facial expressions also contribute to the formation of lines.

identified_subtypes.explanation: The lines observed are primarily located in the periorbital area. They are very thin and do not create significant shadows, indicating they are superficial.
likely_causes: These lines often form due to the skin in this area being thinner and more delicate.
Dehydration can also temporarily make these fine lines appear more pronounced.
care_education: Keeping the skin well-hydrated is fundamental to improving the appearance of fine lines.
Consistent sun protection is crucial to prevent the breakdown of collagen, which leads to the formation of wrinkles.

pigmentation.rationale_plain: There are several small, scattered darker spots visible on both of your cheeks. These spots create a mild degree of unevenness in your skin tone but do not form large, confluent patches.
possible_causes: Sun exposure is a primary driver for the development of dark spots, especially in sun-exposed areas like the cheeks.
Past inflammation, such as from healed acne blemishes, can also leave behind darker marks.
Hormonal fluctuations can sometimes influence pigment production.

identified_subtypes.explanation: The pigmentation appears as discrete, small-to-medium brown macules on the cheeks, which is a typical appearance for solar lentigines, commonly known as sun spots.
likely_causes: These spots are a direct result of chronic exposure to ultraviolet (UV) light, which stimulates an overproduction of melanin in localized areas.
Living in a sunny location like New Delhi increases this risk.
care_education: Diligent use of a broad-spectrum sunscreen every day is the most important step to prevent new spots from forming and existing ones from darkening.
For existing spots, a consultation with a dermatologist can provide options for treatment.

redness.rationale_plain: Your skin tone appears very even, with no signs of significant or persistent redness. There is a trace amount of redness visible around the nostrils, but this is very minor and localized.
possible_causes: Minor redness around the nose can be common and is often related to slight irritation in that area.
This level of redness is generally considered to be within the normal range.

texture.rationale_plain: Your overall skin texture appears slightly uneven, which is mainly related to the visible pores on your nose and inner cheeks. The skin surface is not perfectly smooth, showing a mild graininess in these areas upon close inspection.
possible_causes: An uneven texture can result from enlarged pores creating interruptions in the skin's surface.
A buildup of dead skin cells can contribute to a less smooth appearance.
The natural decline in the rate of cell turnover as we age can also affect texture.

identified_subtypes.explanation: The skin's microrelief is not uniform, primarily due to the openings of pores creating visible interruptions on the surface, especially in the T-zone.
likely_causes: This is often linked to areas with higher sebum production.
A lack of regular, gentle exfoliation can also contribute to surface roughness.
care_education: Maintaining skin hydration can help improve its overall smoothness.
Gentle exfoliation can help to remove dead skin cells and refine the skin's surface, but it's important not to overdo it to avoid irritation.

acne.rationale_plain: Your skin is largely clear of acne lesions. There are a few very small, non-inflamed bumps visible on the chin, but there are no widespread comedones (blackheads or whiteheads) or inflammatory blemishes.
possible_causes: Occasional minor bumps are common and can be influenced by factors like hormonal fluctuations.
Stress and environmental factors can also play a role in minor breakouts.

citations.title: Review of acne grading scales incl. GAGS (PMC)

under_eye.rationale_plain: There is a noticeable and well-defined darkening of the skin in the under-eye area on both sides. This discoloration creates a contrast with the skin on your upper cheeks, contributing to a tired appearance.
possible_causes: Under-eye circles are often a hereditary or genetic trait.
The skin in this area is very thin, which can make underlying blood vessels more visible.
An actual increase in skin pigment (hyperpigmentation) can also cause darkness.

identified_subtypes.explanation: The visible dark circles have a distinct brownish tone, which suggests an excess of melanin (pigment) in the skin of the under-eye area.
likely_causes: This can be a hereditary trait that is common in certain ethnicities.
Chronic sun exposure can also contribute to or worsen pigmentary dark circles.
care_education: Protecting the eye area with sunscreen and sunglasses is important.
Gentle care is key for this delicate area; avoid rubbing your eyes.

identified_subtypes.explanation: In addition to the color, there is a slight depression along your tear trough. This creates a shadow that can accentuate the appearance of darkness.
likely_causes: The anatomy of the fat pads and ligaments under the eye is genetically determined.
Natural volume loss with age can create or deepen this hollow.
care_education: While topical products can help with hydration and pigmentation, addressing structural hollows often requires in-office procedures.
A consultation with a dermatologist can provide a full assessment of contributing factors.

citations.title: Validated photonumeric scale for infraorbital dark circles (PMC)

limitations: This is a non-diagnostic analysis based on visual information from smartphone photos and should not replace professional medical advice.
Lighting variations can affect the assessment of tone and pigmentation.
The analysis does not measure skin hydration or oil production levels directly.
